glsa.title: NTFS-3G: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in NTFS-3G allows local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: NTFS-3G is a stable, full-featured, read-write NTFS driver for various operating systems.

description.p: The NTFS-3G driver does not properly clear environment variables before invoking mount or umount.
This flaw is similar to the vulnerability described in “GLSA-201701-19” and “GLSA-201603-04” referenced below but is now implemented in the NTFS-3G driver itself.

impact.p: A local user could gain root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. However, on Gentoo when the “suid” USE flag is not set (which is the default) an attacker cannot exploit the flaw.
